review_title: Perfect coral color with gold shimmer
review_content:
BEST BLUSH EVER! I got the color Flowerchild and it is truly the most beautiful blush I have ever used. It is a gorgeous light coral pink color with little flecks of gold shimmer. You honestly don't even need highlighter when you use this blush. It is basically everything NARS Orgasm tries to be but fails at. Also, a little goes a long way, you need only one swipe and the color lasts all day. I have been using for 3 months and haven't even made a dent in it. I am a makeup junkie and I recommend this product. The only downside is you need to make sure you don't drop it cause it is soft (mineral texture) and could break if it falls on a hard surface.

review_content:
I bought the shade Lantana online, and when I received it, I was so disappointed in the size... my fault for not reading the dimensions, but I was expecting the same size as their highlighters. My disappointment didn’t last long, because with BARELY a tap of my brush, I was able to sweep so much pigment onto my cheeks. That one tap was almost too much, I had to dab some off! This shade is true to color, so bold but can be diluted to look so natural. No caking, and doesn’t add texture to my already textured cheeks. I’ve had the same blush for a year without hitting pan, and since I don’t wear this color every day, it will continue to last me a while. Worth the money, because it’s better quality than some multiple blush pans I own.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I sort of randomly picked up this blush one day at Sephora and I'm so glad I did! I've been wearing NARS blush for several years and now i'll be sticking to Becca. I bought the Wild Honey shade, which gives you just the right glow and lasts throughout the day!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I absolutely love this blush! The formula is smooth and easily blendable, but I bought this blush for the shade. It's a perfect everyday, natural looking blush that just warms up the entire face and gives me a nice glow. I'm pretty fair, but I feel like this blush can compliment many ranges of skin tones. It is very pigmented and a little goes a long way.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
Wild Honey is my holy grail blush. I very rarely steer away from Wild Honey unless it's a special occasion and I want to do something different. I have lightish skin with olive/yellow undertones so I prefer peaches to pinks, and once I saw Jaclyn Hill recommend this I had to try it. It's the perfect nude blush. It breaks up on the face a bit by the end of an 10-hour day but I blame my dewy foundation for that. I've had it for about a year or more, so yes it is pricey but it lasts a LONG time. I've hit pan big time but I'm still using it until it's gone, and I plan on re-purchasing.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: With an oily face, I was nervous that the shimmery blush would make me look shinier. Not true! It creates a beautiful dewy look. Previous blushes that I've tried make blemishes more visible. Since it's highly pigmented, it actually helps to cover up blemishes on my cheeks! Amazing!!!

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: I never thought that blush would be something I'm complimented on so often but becca proved me wrong. I really think the golden highlights in this product are what make it so beautiful. Even though it's a powder it doesn't make my face look flat at. And I'm not the best at applying makeup so the fact that I can put this on and not look like a clown is A+ in my book.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: It does exactly what you want it to
review_content:
I'm not sure how much can be said about blush, but here it goes. I usually reach for this brand, though I have it in several colors. It has an even, buildable pigment that blends seamlessly, and works equally well on many different foundations, whether dewey or matte/powdered. I've never had issues with fallout, transfer, caking, or it wearing off. I'm no expert and I find this easy to apply, regardless of whether I want it subtle or bold. My only complaint is that a few of the colors aren't carried at Sephora, but I'm sure that's a problem with Becca, not Sephora or the product.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I purchased 'Wild Honey' first and really liked the blush itself, but the color was too dark for my skin unless I used a little. I tried 'Flowerchild' instead and really love how it looks on me and a little does go a long way to have an impact on your cheeks! I love the glow-y finish that makes it look natural enough for my work makeup. FYSA, this packaging is smaller than the Becca highlight powders.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: Wonderful! Beautiful color and nice sheen that one would not expect to want in a blush, but turns out to be beautiful and really make the face flawless.
I have two of these colors. They pop! So you don't need much application. They are creamy and blend-able. No fall out. They work well with the Becca highliters!
